intro: Guatteria denudata, commonly known as the naked guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, fleshy berries. Guatteria denudata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
